page.title: 01Farmland around Curry Mallet
page.content: This area consists of farmland in which there are the isolated villages of Curry Mallet (population 280), Beercrocombe (population 120), Isle Abbots (population 160) and part of fivehead(population 800). Much of the land is owned by the Duchy of Cornwall and the Prince of Wales takes a keen interest in the area, making frequent visits. Farming is principally dairying but sheep, poultry and pigs are farmed. Crops are grown for hay and silage. The whole area of gently rolling countryside is interlaced with a seemingly enormous number of narrow lanes. These are very prone to flooding and are usually extremely muddy during the winter months, as a result of this and the farming activity.
